chapter.title: Defining a Spacecraft's Orbit
chapter.para: To learn how to to define the initial state for a spacecraft orbit, youâ€™ll configure GMAT to propagate the International Space Station (ISS). Starting from the default mission, first set the initial epoch:

step.para: In the Resources tree, right-click on DefaultSC, and click Rename.
Type ISS in the Rename Dialog Box and then click OK.
On the Resources tree, double-click on ISS.
Make sure the Orbit tab is selected.
Click on the Epoch Format drop-down menu and select UTCGregorian.
Type 21 Oct 2011 14:01:29.130 in the Epoch text box.

chapter.para: Now follow the steps below to set the orbital state for ISS:

step.para: In the Resources tree, double-click on DefaultSC to open it.
Make sure the Orbit tab is selected.
Click the State Type drop-down menu and select Keplerian.
In the Elements parameter list on the Spacecraft dialog box, type 6771.907 in the SMA text box.
Type 0.00103 in the ECC text box.
Type 51.597 in the INC text box.
Type 244.300 in the RAAN text box.
Type 353.735 in the AOP text box.
Type 199.683 in the TA text box.

chapter.para: The script for the spacecraft state configured above is show below.
chapter.programlisting: Create Spacecraft ISS ISS.DateFormat=UTCGregorian ISS.Epoch = 21 Oct 2011 14:01:29.130 ISS.SMA = 6771.907 ISS.ECC = 0.00103 ISS.INC = 51.597 ISS.RAAN = 244.300 ISS.AOP = 353.735 ISS.TA = 199.683
